body:
That panel is to import ZAP's Root CA cert only, nevertheless it should show an appropriate error message.

To import client certs you should use "Options" > "Certificate" panel instead. [1]

[1] https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-core-help/wiki/HelpUiDialogsOptionsCertificate

issue.title: Tweak import ZAP Root CA certificate error message

milestone.description: Enhancements and bug fixes expected to be included in the next main release.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change the error message shown when the import of ZAP Root CA
certificate failed to explicitly mention that's attempting to import ZAP
Root CA certificate (not other certificates). Also, merge the resource
messages shown in the error (2nd part is not used in other error
messages).

Related to #2526 - CA Certs errors

body: I had this error to and googled for the problem. I found this thread. @thc202 if only ZAP is allowed, the errormessage should be only Zap Root CA are allowed instead of "could not import". It was not for me..

The message was changed to:

> Failed to import ZAP Root CA certificate from the file.
> Please see log file for details.

The change is expected to be included in the new ZAP version 2.6.0.

@eL-Prova do you need to import other cert than ZAP's?

@thc202 sorry had hadn't seen it should be in 2.6.0. Maybe it is good to make it clear in GUI that only ZAP CA is allowed. It will be prevent that people will first import a CA which is not allowed and see only the message with action to take a look in the log. :)
Well, technically you can import other root CA certs (as long as it contains the private key). Will tweak the error message to also mention that case.

issue.title: Improve error handling on .pem root CA cert import

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change DynamicSSLPanel to warn/inform if the .pem file does not contain
the required sections (certificate and private key), also, warn if the
sections are not properly base64 encoded.
Change SslCertificateUtils to support the previous changes.
Add some tests to assert the expected behaviour of SslCertificateUtils.

Fix #2526 - CA Certs errors

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
